data.title: Great Stay
data.text: Old place but with a great price rooms are very clean, comfortable beds, pool was very clean staff is so nice breakfast is good not a 5 star motel but still make you feel comfortable I would definitely go back.

data.title: Would Definately stay again!!
data.text: Definitely a good quiet place to stay. This motel is an older motel but their rooms are very clean, comfortable beds, pool was very clean, breakfast was decent and the staff was nice and friendly. I would definitely stay here again.

data.title: decent place with horrible internet
data.text:
we have stayed at this property many times and get a decent room at a decent price.  yes its an older hotel but its still comfortable, clean, and has terrific value.

bring your broadband internet, since this is, well, a typical old hotel internet (translation: dont stay here if you need internet service).  fortunately, there is a cell tower nearby, so the t-mobile broadband works well.

data.title: Going downhill
data.text:
A group of us have been doing an annual trip to Yuma for years - we were so happy when we found the Yuma Cabana, it was a perfect fit! Decent rooms at a value price, nice staff, a fine little sitting area by the pool, and the undeniable pleasing kitsch factor.

New management took over, and the poor old Cabana has suffered. Raised prices, reduced services? It happens, but what a shame.

Housekeeping during our last stay was somewhere between haphazard & awful. One person in our group was given a room that had dog poop on the carpet that they hadn't bothered to notice or clean up - the rest of the rooms were nominally poop-free, none were particularly clean.

Breakfast, never a big thing here back in the day, got even worse. A few off-brand wrapped pastries, plus the world's worst coffee, offered in tiny quantities in the lobby.

Worst, though, was that all the security locks were broken or disabled, which with the layout of the hotel allows unobserved access to pretty much any room corridor. I am certainly not a paranoid traveler, but at the same time I think one should be aware of sketchy situations, and this sure felt like one.

I do hope they can get their act back together, but for now the Cabana's lost our business.

data.title: Where's Barry Manilow?  He's at the Yuma, Yuma Cabana!
data.text: I've stayed here several times, both with buddies road-trippin' and my wife on different occasions.  The palm trees over the pool create a great atmosphere.  I think someone must clean the baseboards in the hallways with a toothbrush.  Man, this place is clean.  Our room, I believe I always get room 207, has two queen beds and a recliner.  The balcony looks out over the pool.  It's a great place to stay.  I still haven't found Barry Manilow.

data.title: Poor Old Classic
data.text:
Classic motel needs tender love and care but isn't getting it.  Old place with big room and sliding glass doors on ground floor.

The mattress was so saggy that I felt as if I was sleeping in a bowl.  As others have said, this place has cockroaches.  The roaches in my room were huge.  Make sure you keep all of your luggage closed at all times, and check any outside pockets if you have them or you could be taking some unwanted passengers home with you.

data.title: Pleasant Surprise
data.text: Stopped here for the night on our way to our main vacation spot. Our main vacation destination was a five star resort, and I left the Yuma Cabana Motel wondering if my next hotel stop would be as pleasant. The staff at Yuma Cabana was nice, the rooms were very clean and maintained with fresh paint. I was hesitant to stay in a hotel that was so economical, but it was a better experience than places I've paid twice as much for. Give this place and it's wonderful employees an opportunity to show you their great bargain motel.

data.title: Great value near Algodones
data.text: You'll find many necessaries in this charming old 60s motel: Dish TV, pool, light breakfast, good plumbing, OK WiFi and VERY affordable. I stayed two nights in July while getting dental work done across the border. This glam-shabby classic is in the middle of the restaurant district and about five minutes from the interstate. It's run by a very friendly American family and the breakfast nook was clean and spartan. It was tastefully renovated in the last few years and everything is ship-shape. Loved early-morning swims.

data.title: will be back
data.text: I am very content with my stay at Yuma Cabana. The front desk staff was awesome very friendly. Being that is is an older motel their rooms are well maintained and clean. They are also working on making it that much better I noticed that they have recently put in new lock systems, they are putting new flat screen tvs in every room. their breakfast is simple but good for the price. I would definitely come back and stay here on my next trip into town.

data.title: Do not look any further! !!
data.text: We have been coming here for 9 years. The staff is always amazing! Especially this year. Greg is one of a kind and will go above and beyond!! We will never go anywhere else. If you are looking for a pool and conveniently located, look no further!!! (This is coming from a person who lived in yuma for half her childhood)

data.title: Could be better
data.text: Smell from bug killer made it difficult to breath. Old and rough shape. Counter person seemed like a nice guy. If you need a cheap room and all else is booked, take a chance. Make sure you look at their rooms before paying.

data.title: Only Place I'll Stay If I Return!
data.text:
I stayed at the Yuma Cabana for just over a week at the end of April / beginning of May of 2015. From the get go I was impressed. I was initially greeted by Wendy who was not only the friendliest hotel person I've met but also was so very helpful, allowing me to leave my baggage in the lobby while I spent an hour walking to a Western Union to get money to pay for the night. The option of being able to have a cash deposit was also very nice as I do not use credit cards (I know, I'm the minority here). The rate was nice and later, when I had a family member book me additional nights via the Internet, the rate was even cheaper! And what did I get for this  attractive rate? Not only a very nice Queen bed but a La Z Boy recliner, mini-fridge, microwave, blow dryer and a very spacious balcony. The room was very clean and the housekeeping very good every morning. The pool outside was not the biggest but still very nice and clean with a few patio tables shaded by umbrellas. The breakfast was nothing to write home about but no complaints. Cereal, fruit, muffins, danish and a selection of juices. My only (minor) complaint was that the Wi-Fi could be a little spotty. The staff, though, moved me to a different room with a better connection right away and that solved the problem.
In conclusion, the place was great and the staff was super friendly and courteous and helpful. Thanks for a very great and comfortable stay, Yuma Cabana! Wendy is the best!

-DRB

data.title: had a nice stay , planning to stay again
data.text: When I first arrived I was greeted very kindly by the front desk , they we very helpful and I had a nice check in. i spent two nights there and I can I will come again. The thing i most like about this place is that my bed was very comfortable and everyone was so nice and very willing to help. i had a nice clean room.

data.title: Will be back!
data.text:
During my first stay in Yuma I stayed at this motel, I was greeted by very courteous hotel staff. The breakfast was good.
I had a pleasant stay.the rooms were clean and maintained very well.
The motel is very close to other restaurants, groceries etc.

data.title: New owners, horrible dirty cockroach infested rooms.
data.text: My family and I have stayed at Yuma Cabana for 10 years and was always pleased. Until it sold to new owners last year. Right away we noticed during check in that the staff was different and seemed insincere. Then as we unloaded baggage, we noticed that the place had fallen into disrepair. Our room was not even clean. There was still bar soap and hair in the shower. The shower door fell off when my husband touched it and the shower floor had black grime. The towels were stained and we didn't have hot water. All night we heard fighting and yelling. Worst thing, we saw cockroaches running across the floor. We are so sad because we loved the old staff and the clean rooms. We checked out early and even during check out the desk clerk seemed confused about the procedure. We went to another motel and was told by other guests that they no longer stay at Yuma Cabana for the same reasons as us. Avoid this motel!!!!

data.title: Its a bed, no more
data.text:
We stayed one night. And wouldn't go for a second.

It's a tired old hotel which is way over expiration date. The area is having what you need. Fast food, supermarkets and good connection to the freeway.

data.title: DIRTY.. COCKROACH INFEST.. RUDE FRONT DESK
data.text: RUN RUN..MOST HORRIBLE DIRTY motel  have ever stayed in.cockroaches  everywhere. bathroom had NO HOT WATER.front desk crew very very RUDE.room had sickly sweet odor..we were double billed so another problem.

data.title: Ok for one night stay
data.text: I booked 2 rooms for one night.  The room was well equipped with fridge, microwave and lazyboy chair.  The tv was very old and the reception was fuzzy.  The wifi worked fine.  The room it self was dated and worn.  Had a bit of a musty smell.  The swimming pool was heated (that`s what we were told), but was too cold to swim in.  Breakfast was better than most. . . had milk and juice, 3 different breakfast cereals, oatmeal, coffee & tea, lots of pastries and bananas and apples.  The sleep quality was good.  The room was very large.  Overall, good value for the $$$

data.title: Never Again!
data.text: Very budget motel. You get what you pay for,  and for us a cockroach.The breakfast was very basic. If we didn't wear shoes our feet got filthy from walking on the floor. Next time I would pay a few extra bucks for a nicer hotel.

data.title: Decent Room for the Price
data.text: After an awful nights stay at another area motel, we were happy that this motel was able to accommodate us for our second night in Yuma. The staff was very friendly and although it was an older motel, the room was clean. The breakfast was simple and consisted of a few cereals, juice, coffee and pastries. Our only complaint was that we could not get our wifi to work. We did not complain about it as it wasn't absolutely necessary, but it would have been nice to have.
